# Extras

## Resources for further learning

There are tons of useful resources out there, and many of them are free! Below I have listed a few that I have found useful, but this is by no means an exhaustive list.  


Tutorials for programming and data skills: 

- [The Carpentries](https://carpentries.org/lessons/) 

- [Dr. Karl Broman's Tutorials](https://kbroman.org/tutorials)

Tutorials for bioinformatics:

- [NYU Bioinformatics Tutorials](https://learn.gencore.bio.nyu.edu/)

Books about bioinformatics: 

- [Bioinformatics Data Skills](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/bioinformatics-data-skills/9781449367480/)

- [Bioinformatics for Beginners](https://www.sciencedirect.com/book/9780124104716/bioinformatics-for-beginners) -- This one is available to you online from the university. 


Helpful YouTube Series:

- [Dr. Aaron Quinlan's Applied Computational Biology Course](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCbXw1opqIQeNfF26-wWegdGoCC1aut0P)

- [Prof Greg's Intro to Phylogenetics](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjPAsbaa7pgGOrSPNBojU6lFCsJj7pvdJ)
